Message.Title: Many, many years ago, some one asked,,,"Why do you play long term options?"
Message.Msg: For the same reason why Will Sutton, the notorious bank robber answered when asked "why do you rob banks?"...."it is because that is where the money is!" the key to playing these is timing.....Last year, about this time I suggested to close out theAAPL Jan 2013 $600 CALLS FOR A $40 PROFIT then sell the JAN 2014 $600 CALLS FOR ANOTHER $80... I did not foresee the price fall... was just chasing the premium on an asset....just an hunch By the way, those AAPL moves eventually totaled $225 with a third trade. So anyone who bought AAPL at $600 has not lost money IF they agreed and acted upon my suggestions. I am rather proud of those ideas

GOOG can hit $1000 and the premium will fall..allowing a shareholder to trade up or do nothing...Yes, the shares can be taken but "who cares!" you have made your 11% GOOG can "trend" water" or fall and the premium will fall allowing the shareholder the same. all three situations, the shareholder is in control

Message.Title: Most Undervalued Tech Stock on NASDAQ
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) currently $7.49 has only 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $65.57mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $43.2m. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.68X revenues of $63.23mm, 6.06X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 7.71X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter and it just raised its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a yield of 6.41%. CCUR is the leader of some of the world's hottest technologies! CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm streams deployed worldwide and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. The #2 VOD technology vendor Seachange (SEAC) closed last week at $11.79 and is about to break its 52-week high of $12.10. SEAC has an enterprise value of $271.86mm or 1.74X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.6X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 20.02X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.74X revenues would value CCUR at $15.12 per share. An enterprise value of 15.6X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $15.26 per share. An enterprise value of 20.02X free cash flow will value CCUR at $15.36 per share. CCUR also has the leading Big Data Analytics software being used by pay-TV operators. CCUR tracks the behavior of 35mm pay-TV subscribers and has processed 15 billion media transactions. Big Data Analytics is the hottest space on Wall Street. Tableau Software (DATA) recently had its IPO at $31 and hit a new 52-week high on Friday of $63 for a gain of 103%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 25X revenues vs. CCUR's enterprise value of 0.68X revenues!
